    • Method Detail

      • onCreate

        public void onCreate()
        Try to get an instance of BluetoothManager which is the system service for Bluetooth. If fails, it will broadcast an intent of which the action is ACTION_INITIALIZATION_FAILURE.
        Overrides:
        onCreate in class android.app.Service

      • onStartCommand

        public int onStartCommand(android.content.Intent intent,
                          int flags,
                          int startId)
        Check if Bluetooth is enabled when execute the start command.
        Overrides:
        onStartCommand in class android.app.Service
        Parameters:
        intent - Intent: The Intent supplied to Context.startService(Intent), as given. This may be null if the service is being restarted after its process has gone away, and it had previously returned anything except Service.START_STICKY_COMPATIBILITY.
        flags - int: Additional data about this start request.
        startId - int: A unique integer representing this specific request to start. Use with Service.stopSelfResult(int).
        Returns:
        The return value indicates what semantics the system should use for the service's current started state. It may be one of the constants associated with the Service.START_CONTINUATION_MASK bits.

      • onDestroy

        public void onDestroy()
        Before destroying this service, the following things will be done. Close the connected bluetooth device. Release all system resources, mBluetoothManager and mBluetoothAdapter before destroyed. Reset mBleScanning to false and discard all the pending callbacks in mBleScanningHandler. Reset mProcessingRxTxJobs to false and discard all the pending BluetoothLeService.RxTxJobs in mRxTxJobs.
        Overrides:
        onDestroy in class android.app.Service

      • onBind

        public android.os.IBinder onBind(android.content.Intent intent)
        Specified by:
        onBind in class android.app.Service

      • onUnbind

        public boolean onUnbind(android.content.Intent intent)
        Overrides:
        onUnbind in class android.app.Service

      • bluetoothIsEnabled

        boolean bluetoothIsEnabled()
        Check if Bluetooth is enabled.
        Returns:
        True if Bluetooth is enabled, otherwise, false and broadcast intent with ACTION_BLUETOOTH_ENABLED_REQUIRED action.

      • scanBleDevices

        void scanBleDevices(boolean enable)
        Scan or stop scanning BLE devices.
        Parameters:
        enable - True for starting scanning and false for stop scanning.

      • getBluetoothDevice

        android.bluetooth.BluetoothDevice getBluetoothDevice(java.lang.String address)
        Get a BluetoothDevice according to the device address.
        Parameters:
        address - String: The MAC address of the target bluetooth device.
        Returns:
        BluetoothDevice: The BluetoothDevice whose device address is equal to the provided one. Null if no qualified device is found.

      • getSelectedBluetoothDeviceName

        java.lang.String getSelectedBluetoothDeviceName()
        Get the device name of the selected Bluetooth device stored in mSelectedBluetoothDevice.
        Returns:
        String: the name of the selected bluetooth device.

      • setCharacteristicNotification

        public void setCharacteristicNotification(android.bluetooth.BluetoothGattCharacteristic characteristic,
                                          java.util.UUID configDescriptorUUID,
                                          boolean enabled)
        Enables or disables notification on a give characteristic.
        Parameters:
        characteristic - BluetoothGattCharacteristic: the characteristic which the notification is from. This characteristic must support "Notify" property.
        configDescriptorUUID - UUID: the UUID of Client Characteristic Configuration Descriptor.
        enabled - boolean: true for enable notification, false for turn off notification.

      • getRssiVal

        public boolean getRssiVal()

      • processRxTxJobs

        private void processRxTxJobs()
        If all the Rx or Tx jobs are submitted to mSelectedBluetoothGatt at the same time without waiting for any former job to be completed. mSelectedBluetoothGatt will save and execute the final submitted job. Therefore, mRxTxJobs and this function are designed for processing Rx and Tx jobs sequentially.

      • broadcastUpdate

        private void broadcastUpdate(java.lang.String action)

      • broadcastUpdate

        private void broadcastUpdate(java.lang.String action,
                             android.bluetooth.BluetoothGattCharacteristic characteristic)
